meanings.definition: A person who lapses or falls behind in duties or obligations.
meanings.sent1: The lapsers in the group struggled to keep up with their assignments.
meanings.sent2: The manager had a meeting with the lapsers to discuss their progress.
meanings.sent3: The lapsers in the office always seemed to be a step behind, but they never gave up.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a lapsed runner in a race, always trying to catch up.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lapsers lagging behind stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: The act of lapsing or falling behind in duties or obligations.
meanings.sent1: The lapsers of the team caused delays in the project timeline.
meanings.sent2: Lapses in communication led to misunderstandings among the lapsers.
meanings.sent3: The lapsers of the group decided to have a race to see who could fall behind the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The lapsers of time seemed to stretch endlessly, never catching up.
meanings.sent5: The lapsers of the marathon struggled to reach the finish line.
